#================================================================================= # Script to identify group policy failures # # Author: Kevin Justin # # Version: 1.0 # #=================================================================================
#================================================================================= # Constants section - modify stuff here: #================================================================================= # Assign script name variable for use in event logging. # ScriptName should be the same as the ID of the module that the script is contained in $ScriptName = "Microsoft.Windows.Server.2012.AD.Configuration.GroupPolicy.Monitor.Recovery.Task.v1025.ps1" $EventID = "552" #=================================================================================
# Starting Script section - All scripts get this #================================================================================= # Gather the start time of the script $StartTime = Get-Date #Set variable to be used in logging events $whoami = whoami # Load MOMScript API $momapi = New-Object -comObject MOM.ScriptAPI #Log script event that we are starting task $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Script is starting. `n Running as ($whoami).") #=================================================================================
# PropertyBag Script section - Monitoring scripts get this #================================================================================= # Load SCOM PropertyBag function $bag = $momapi.CreatePropertyBag() #=================================================================================
# Begin MAIN script section #=================================================================================
# Configure $Time to look at event log $date = get-date -uFormat "%Y-%m-%d" $Time = [DateTime](Get-Date).AddHours(-2)
$momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Gather AD Configuration GroupPolicy alert detail for date ($date).") $DSMessage = "Proactive AD Configuration GroupPolicy alert detail for date ($date)."
# Event example # Event Log = Microsoft-Windows-GroupPolicy/Operational # Event Level = Error # Event ID = 7016 # Event Description = Completed Microsoft Disk Quota Extension Processing in 0 milliseconds.
$GroupPolicyAlerts = Get-WinEvent -LogName "Microsoft-Windows-GroupPolicy/Operational" | ? { ( $_.TimeCreated -gt "$Time" ) -AND ( $_.ID -eq "7016" ) } $GroupPolicyAlerts.count
if ( $GroupPolicyAlerts.count -eq 0 ) { $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"ZERO Group Policy 7016 events in past hour") }
if ( $GroupPolicyAlerts.count -gt 0 ) { # Create table output $GroupPolicyReport = @()
$GroupPolicyReport += "" $GroupPolicyReport += "DSMessage" $GroupPolicyReport += "#" $GroupPolicyReport += "# Group Policy Error event 7016 details for $($ENV:Computername)" $GroupPolicyReport += "#========================================================" $GroupPolicyReport += $GroupPolicyAlerts | select TimeCreated,ID,Message | out-string
$GroupPolicyReport = $GroupPolicyReport | out-string $GroupPolicyReport
$momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"$GroupPolicyReport") }
$GroupPolicyFilteredAlerts = Get-WinEvent -LogName "Microsoft-Windows-GroupPolicy/Operational" | ? { ( $_.TimeCreated -gt "$Time" ) -AND ( $_.ID -eq "5313" ) } $GroupPolicyFilteredAlerts.count
if ( $GroupPolicyFilteredAlerts.count -eq 0 ) { $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"ZERO Group Policy 7016 events in past hour") }
if ( $GroupPolicyFilteredAlerts.count -gt 0 ) { # Create table output $GroupPolicyFilteredReport = @()
$GroupPolicyFilteredReport += "" $GroupPolicyFilteredReport += "DSMessage" $GroupPolicyFilteredReport += "#" $GroupPolicyFilteredReport += "# Group Policy Error event 5313 details for $($ENV:Computername)" $GroupPolicyFilteredReport += "#========================================================" $GroupPolicyFilteredReport += $GroupPolicyAlerts | ft TimeCreated,ID,Message -auto -wrap | out-string
$GroupPolicyFilteredReport = $GroupPolicyFilteredReport | out-string $GroupPolicyFilteredReport
$momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"$GroupPolicyFilteredReport") }
# End of script section #================================================================================= #Log an event for script ending and total execution time. $EndTime = Get-Date $ScriptTime = ($EndTime - $StartTime).TotalSeconds $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Script Completed. `n Script Runtime: ($ScriptTime) seconds.") write-host "Script Completed. Script Runtime: ($ScriptTime) seconds." #================================================================================= # End of script
